intro: Reseda phyteuma subsp. barcinonensis, commonly known as the Barcinońskie Reseda, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and slopes. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
